description:
'''Sabah al-Din Abu Qaws''' ({{langx|ar|صباح الدين أبو قوس}}; May 2, 1933 – November 2, 2021), also known as '''Sabah Fakhri''' ({{langx|ar|صباح فخري|links=no}}, {{IPA|apc-SY|sˤɑˈbɑːħ ˈfæχɾi|label=[[Syrian Arabic]] pronunciation:}}), was a Syrian [[tenor]] singer from [[Aleppo]].

With over 50 years of fame and popularity as a singer, Sabah Fakhri modified and popularized the then-fading forms of traditional Arabic music [[Muwashahat]] and [[Qudud Halabiya]]. He was well known for his beautiful strong vocals, impeccable control and execution of [[Arabic maqam|Maqam]]at and [[harmony]], as well as his dominant and charismatic performances on stage. In the Arab world, he is regarded as one of the greatest artists of all time.
